118
119/******************************************************************************
120 *
121 * @brief entry point for programming the INFO0(customer) block NVRAM
122 *
123 * Calling this function programs multiple words in the INFO0 block on one nv instance
124 *
125 * @param value customer info key
126 * @param pSrc pointer to word aligned array of data to program into the NV INFO block
127 * @param Offset word offset in to info block (0x01 means the second 32 bit word)
128 * NOTE Offset == 0 --> first word in INFO0.
129 * @param NumberOfWords number of words to program
130 *
131 * @return 0 for success, non-zero for failure
132 * 1 Invalid Key
133 * 2 Invalid destination start address
134 * 3 Invalid destination end address
135 * 4 Invalid source buffer start address
136 * 5 Invalid source buffer end address
137 * 6 Hardware error
138 * 7 Reserved
139 * 8 Hardware error
140 * 9 OTP interrupts detected
141 * 10 Memory not powered on
142 * 11 Area is write protected
143 * 12 Area is copy protected
144 * 13 Internal error
145 *
146 *****************************************************************************/
147int
148nv_program_info_area(uint32_t value,
149 uint32_t *pSrc,
150 uint32_t Offset,
151 uint32_t NumberOfWords);
152
153/******************************************************************************
154 *
155 * @brief Enhanced version of nv_program_main which passes through more of
156 * the features of nv_program.
157 *
158 * Calling this function programs up to N words of the MAIN block of NVRAM
159 *
160 * @param value customer program key
161 * @param Program_nWipe boolean option: 1 = Addr_WipeData is the source address (pointer)
162 * (pSrc can not point back in to NVRAM itself)
163 * 0 = Addr_WipeData is data word to write repeatedly during wipe
164 * @param Addr_WipeData if Program_nWipe is 0, then single word value to write repeatedly to NVRAM
165 * if Program_nWipe is 1, then 32-bit start byte address of region to write to NVRAM
166 * @param WordOffset word offset from the start of NVRAM to program
167 * @param NumberOfWords number of 32-bit words to program
168 *
169 * @return 0 for success, non-zero for failure
170 * 1 Invalid Key
171 * 2 Invalid destination start address
172 * 3 Invalid destination end address
173 * 4 Invalid source buffer start address
174 * 5 Invalid source buffer end address
175 * 6 Hardware error
176 * 7 Reserved
177 * 8 Hardware error
178 * 9 OTP interrupts detected
179 * 10 Memory not powered on
180 * 11 Area is write protected
181 * 12 Area is copy protected
182 * 13 Internal error
183 *
184 *****************************************************************************/
185int
186nv_program_main2(uint32_t value,
187 uint32_t Program_nWipe,
188 uint32_t Addr_WipeData,
189 uint32_t WordOffset,
190 uint32_t NumberOfWords);
191
192
193#ifdef __cplusplus
194}
195#endif
196
197#endif // AM_HAL_BOOTROM_HELPER_H
